com.ibm.team.repository.client.util

Interface IClientLibraryContext


  • public interface IClientLibraryContext
    Provides special access to the team repository from the client libraries for accessing service interfaces.

    The context should not be passed around to clients and is meant as a private accessor for the client libraries implementation. If a client library wants to expose it's service interface as-is to clients, it should provide it's own typed method to return the service interface but should not give this context to clients.

    The client library context is valid for the lifetime of a team repository instance and can be safely used whether the repository is logged in or not. The service interface methods can only be safely called while the repository is logged in.

    Since:
    0.5

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IClientLibraryContext.IServiceRunnable<T>
      The IServiceRunnable interface should be implemented by any class whose instances are intended to be executed as a long-running cancelable operation that makes calls to service methods.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T callCancelableService(IClientLibraryContext.IServiceRunnable<T> runnable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Runs the given IServiceRunnable in this context.
      java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] getServerCertificatePath()

    • Method Detail

      • teamRepository

        ITeamRepository teamRepository()
        Returns the repository associated with this context. The repository may not be logged in when the context is made available.
        Returns:
        the repository, which is never null

      • getServiceInterface

        java.lang.Object getServiceInterface(java.lang.Class interfaceClass)
        Returns the given service interface or null if the service interface is not known to this repository. Service interfaces are generally considered an implementation detail of a component and aren't made available to regular clients. Don't pass them around to your clients unless that is the contract you want your clients to use.

        The service interface can remain usable between login and logout of the repository but it's method can only be called when the repository is logged in.

        Parameters:
        interfaceClass - the service interface class for which we want an instance; must not be null
        Returns:
        an instance of the service interface class, or null if the given interface class is not registered with the repository

      • callCancelableService

        <T> T callCancelableService(IClientLibraryContext.IServiceRunnable<T> runnable,
                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException

        Runs the given IServiceRunnable in this context.

        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable to run; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the object returned from invoking the IServiceRunnable's run method
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if the logout was unsuccessful for any reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getServerCertificatePath

        java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] getServerCertificatePath()
        Returns the server's certificate path, or null if none or unknown. Calling this method before a service call establishes a connection will return null.
        Since:
        0.7
